Name: ADOIT:Community Edition
Motivation: Enterprise architecture management

Name: ArchiMate
Motivation: Enterprise architecture
Notes: Eclipse-based; collaboration provided by coArchi over Git

Name: ARIS
Motivation: Business process modeling

Name: ASCET Developer
Motivation: "easily combine texts and graphics suiting your programming needs"
Notes: The tool generates ESDL out of graphical syntaxes that should not be edited. However, other parts of the ESDL file can be edited.

Name: AToMPM
Motivation: Multi-paradigm modeling on the web

Name: BlendedProfile
Motivation: Blended modelling for UML profiles

Name: Boston
Motivation: Fact-based modeling via Object-Role Modeling (ORM)
Notes: Hit the paywall with this one, so every information comes from the documentation and the videos

Name: Cardanit
Motivation: Modeling BPMN with diagrams and tabular views

Name: Certware
Motivation: Safety case modeling

Name: DBDiagrams
Motivation: Visualize textual DB schema definition

Name: Eclipse Papyrus
Motivation: Generic-purpose MBSE tool, based on UML and providing support for DSLs via UML Profiles

Name: Eclipse Process Framework Project
Motivation: Software process modeling

Name: Gentleman
Motivation: Lightweigh modeling tool using concepts and projections to close the gap between models and domain experts

Name: MagicDraw
Motivation: Modelling tool that facilitates analysis and design of Object Oriented (OO) systems and databases. It provides code engineering mechanism (with full round-trip support for Java, C++, C#, CL (MSIL) and CORBA IDL programming languages), as well as database schema modeling, DDL generation and reverse engineering facilities.

Name: mbdeddr
Motivation: "Boosting productivity and quality by using extensible DSLs, flexible notations and integrated verification tools."
Notes: Since mbeddr is based on MPS, inconsistencies are ignored or removed after changing the projection.

Name: MEMO4ADO
Motivation: Multi-Perspective Enterprise Modeling

Name: MetaEdit+
Motivation: Language workbench design

Name: Modelio
Motivation: Generic modeling tool for UML, BPMN, ArchiMate, SysML, etc
Notes: Collaboration via the Teamwork Manager plugin, based on SVN

Name: OSATE
Motivation: AADL is a language, with different representations. A textual representation provides a comprehensive view of all details of a system, and graphical if one want to hide some details, and allow for a quick navigation in multiple dimensions.
Notes: Collaboration is directly via the Eclipse-based integration with GitHub. the MM is always the same, they simply have 3 different parser-based editors for the same model. The persistence layer is different for textual (.aadl) and graphical models (.aadl_diagram) and the model itself (.aaxl2)

Name: QuickDataBaseDiagrams
Motivation: Modeling DB schemas by text and diagram
Notes: No real collaboration, just the ability to view other's work.

Name: SequenceDiagramOrg
Motivation: Improve the efficiency when creating and working with sequence diagrams by combining text notation scripting and drawing by clicking and dragging in the same model.

Name: SOM/ADOxx
Motivation: "SOM is a comprehensive methodology for modelling business systems. The acronym means Semantic Object Model, expressing that the SOM methodology is both fully object-oriented and designed to capture business semantics explicitly."

Name: Swimlanes
Motivation: Visualize sequence diagrams

Name: TopBraid Composer
Motivation: "TopBraid Enterprise Data Governance? (EDG) is a flexible, web-based solution that addresses data governance needs in enterprise environments with heterogeneous data stores, data processing, and applications. [?] It lets you capture business glossaries, data sources, conceptual models or ontologies, reference data, business applications, policies and more."
Notes: DISCUSS: This is a strange tool. First, you start Eclipse, to run a local web server, and, then, you have to open the new modern web application. Furthermore, this tools aims to model the knowledge (ontology) and structure of a governance. Not software itself. The focus of our SLR is to identify tools related to software modeling, wasn't it?

Name: UMLet
Motivation: Allow textual+visual modeling of UML diagrams
Notes: Exactly the same as T105, as the backend is exactly the same too

Name: UMLetino
Motivation: Allow textual+visual modeling of UML diagrams

Name: Umple
Motivation: Support the convenient modeling across different formalisms. No particular domain targeted, thus, it's a pretty abstract tool.

Name: USE
Motivation: System modeling via a subset of UML + OCL
Notes: No real edit functionality, shocking as it is.
